quotes.quote: Hasty conclusions lead to speedy repentance.
The conclusion does not belong to the artist.
Conclusion means death. Confusion means possibility.
The conclusions of passion are the only reliable ones.
A conclusion is the place where you got tired thinking.
If you jump to conclusions, you make terrible landings.
Jumping to conclusions is often the only exercise some people get, and is always easier than finding the patience to discover the truth.
Jumping to conclusions rarely gets us anywhere we want to be.
Conclusions are ignorance arrested on the path to less ignorance.
I am forced to the conclusion that modern medicine does not know it all.
I have come to the conclusion that it is better to be silent than to speak.
It is presumptuous to draw conclusions about a person from what one has heard.
If a conclusion is not poetically balanced, it cannot be scientifically true.
Jumping to conclusions is a safer sport in the world of our imagination than it is in reality.
You cannot reach a correct conclusion if you begin with an incorrect assumption.
The only way some of us exercise our minds is by jumping to conclusions.
I have come to the conclusion that silence and time are the most precious commodities.
I came to the conclusion that unrealized hopes, even small ones, were always wrenching.
The only possible conclusion the social sciences can draw is: some do, some don't.
The dominance of conclusions over arguments is most pronounced where emotions are involved.
I have come to the conclusion, after many years of sometimes sad experience, that you cannot come to any conclusion at all.
False conclusions which have been reasoned out are infinitely worse than blind impulse.
I have come to the conclusion that politics are too serious a matter to be left to the politicians.
I've come to the conclusion that life is for the taking and just too short to dwell on the negative.
Perhaps the logical conclusion of everyone looking the same is everyone thinking the same.
If you come to the conclusion that there is no conclusion, well, that's a conclusion, too.
I have come to the conclusion that it is attitude that determines how you handle and survive life.
Leaving people to jumped conclusions is sometimes simpler than explaining a complicated truth
The usual false conclusions of mankind are these: a thing exists, therefore it has a right to exist.
Any conclusion you reach about yourself has to be an unseen limitation because there's always more to see.
Your ideas need not have anything to do with reality. Making conclusions is a sure way of not enhancing our perception.
Always be suspicious of conclusions that reinforce uncritical hope and follow comforting traditions of Western thought.
I've come to the conclusion that everybody should marry, including me.
Conclusions are not always pleasant.
I have come to the conclusion that the most important element in human life is faith.
Jumping to conclusions, may be an indication of Borderline Personality Disorder ... I thought you should know.
Those who jump to conclusions may go wrong.
Conclusion: better to be a thinking monk than a postmodern thinker.
I have come to the conclusion that none of us in our generation feels as guilty about sin as we should or as our forefathers did.
Conclusions arrived at through reasoning have very little or no influence in altering the course of our lives.
The logical conclusion to a compassionate and respectful relationship to sentient animals is that we stop eating them.
When someone says his conclusions are objective, he means that they are based on prejudices which many other people share.
In conclusion, there is no conclusion. Things will go on as they always have, getting weirder all the time.
There is no greater mistake than the hasty conclusion that opinions are worthless because they are badly argued.
The conclusion of design flows naturally from the data; we should not shrink from it; we should embrace it and build on it.
A metaphysical conclusion is either a false conclusion or a concealed experimental conclusion.
